content.text: We’ve got the basics down, now let’s put on a blinking light show. We will use a loop, type: while True:
See how your cursor is moved over automatically? You are now in a “loop.” Type light.on(C5)
Let’s wait for a second between flashes. You can tell the computer to wait by typing sleep(1) , which will make the computer wait for one second.
We make the lights flash by turning them on, and now turning them off. Type light.off(C5) , which turns all the lights off.
Finally, should wait one second after the lights turn off before the loop starts over and turns the lights back on. Type sleep(1) .
Press MAKE and watch your board! What patterns can you make when you give light.on() and light.off() a different coordinate?
